text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Iraqi press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
JUMHOURIYA
- Aggressors targeted civilian areas and a number of military sites.
- U.N. preparations for the implementation of the oil-for- food deal continue.
- Barzani says we are not afraid of Washington's missiles.
- Aziz refutes American claims on Iraqi troop movements toward Sulaimaniya.
- Syria concerned about Iraq's territorial integrity.
- Iraq briefs heads of diplomatic missions in Iraq on latest American aggression.
- Turkey seeking resumption of trade with Iraq.
- Non-aligned countries sympathise with Iraq in latest confrontation with America.
- China stresses that Iraq's sovereignty should be respected.
- France concerned about Iraq's territorial integrity.
- Russia opposes the use of force against Iraq.
- Arab League denounces U.S. aggression.
(The above were also carried by THAWRA, AL-IRAQ and AL- QADISSIYA)
THAWRA
- Editorial vows to defeat U.S. in its military confrontation with Iraq.
QADISSIYA - Editorial reiterates Iraqi position to defy
Western no-fly zones over Iraq.
AL-IRAQ
- Editorial stresses position on Iraq's stand on no-fly zones in Iraq.
